result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David W. Clemmons

defendant.name: Clemmons, David W.
defendant.address: 369 Lower Chute Road, Grand Tower, IL 62942

records.addlTxt:
2:05 PM/ RM 301.  Defendant David W. Clemmons in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. is still waiting for counsel and continues to ask for counsel. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:43 PM/ RM 301. Defendant David W. Clemmons in court.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. has filed requests for bond reduction and were routed to Judge's JA. Def. has contacted PD Office and has not yet received counsel. Def. continues to wish for counsel. Court questions if Def. would like to have P.H. within time limits. Def. would like to waive time limits. Court finds good cause to waive time limits. Court advises bond reduction hearing will be scheduled through Judge's office. Def. notes he would like to cancel request. State questions Def. on upcoming court dates. Def. responds. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on November 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.

for bond reduction
Routed to Judge's JA

for Bond Reduction 
Routed to Judge's JA

3:17 PM Defendant David W. Clemmons appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews PD report. Def. continues to ask for counsel. Court agrees Def. needs counsel and finds good cause to go past time limits. Def. asks about bond reduction hearing. Court instructs Def. to file motion request. Def. questions waiver of time limits. Court responds. Def. has been in contact with Atty Laufenberg.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:43 AM Defendant David W. Clemmons appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. has not contacted PD Office yet. Court questions Def. and Def. responds. Court orders Def. to contact PD office. State is in compliance with victim rights.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
No contact with Crab N Jacks or owner of business. 
Surrender passport to Langlade County Sheriff Department.
Not to leave State of Wisconsin.

1:20 PM Defendant David W. Clemmons appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. State gives bail/bond recommendation and gives conditions No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No contact with Crab N Jacks, Surrender passport, Not to leave State of Wisconsin. Def. heard on bond.  Court orders $6,000 cash bond with conditions No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No contact with Crab N Jacks or owner of business, Surrender passport to Langlade County Sheriff Department, Not to leave State of Wisconsin and def. may have bond revisited at later date. Court advised def. to contact P.D.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
